question: According to the video, what is the singular thing that makes someone a Roman Catholic or not?
options: Belief in the real presence in the Eucharist
Belief in the apostolic authority of the papacy
Belief in the veneration of saints
answer: Belief in the apostolic authority of the papacy

question: What does the bishop of Rome (pope) claim according to the video?
options: The divine right to intervene anywhere, anytime in the global church with absolute authority with no appeal
The right to intervene in local churches with the consent of local bishops
The right to provide guidance that can be appealed to church councils
The right to teach only when in agreement with ecumenical councils
answer: The divine right to intervene anywhere, anytime in the global church with absolute authority with no appeal

question: According to the video, how many intertwined teachings does the medieval and modern papal position rest on?
answer: Four

question: What are the four intertwined teachings mentioned in the video?
options: Apostolic succession, Petrine primacy, Roman primacy, and infallibility of the church
Apostolic succession, Petrine primacy, papal infallibility, and universal jurisdiction
Apostolic succession, Petrine primacy, episcopal authority, and sacramental validity
Apostolic succession, Petrine primacy, conciliar authority, and doctrinal development
answer: Apostolic succession, Petrine primacy, Roman primacy, and infallibility of the church

question: According to the video, what do Protestants generally emphasize regarding apostolic succession?
options: Apostolic succession through the laying on of hands
Apostolic succession of office through bishops
Apostolic succession of doctrine focusing on the apostolic teaching of the gospel contained in scripture
Apostolic succession through the preservation of traditions
answer: Apostolic succession of doctrine focusing on the apostolic teaching of the gospel contained in scripture

question: For Catholics, what is valid ministry dependent on according to the video?
options: Whether bishops can trace their ordination all the way back to the apostles
Whether ministers can trace their education back to apostolic times
Whether churches can trace their founding to apostolic times
Whether doctrines can be traced to apostolic writings
answer: Whether bishops can trace their ordination all the way back to the apostles

question: What does Petrine primacy claim about Peter?
options: Peter was one of the most prominent apostles
Peter was the first to confess Christ
Peter received a uniquely authoritative office from Christ that directly placed him over the other apostles
answer: Peter received a uniquely authoritative office from Christ that directly placed him over the other apostles

question: What is Roman Petrine primacy according to the video?
options: The claim that Rome was the capital of the empire
The claim that all bishops must be approved by Rome
The claim that Roman bishops are superior to all other clergy
The combination of the ideas of both apostolic succession and Petrine primacy
answer: The combination of the ideas of both apostolic succession and Petrine primacy

question: According to the video, what is the problem with the schema of apostolic succession?
options: It is not mentioned in scripture at all
It is anachronistic because church structures changed organically with changing circumstances
answer: It is anachronistic because church structures changed organically with changing circumstances

question: What form of church government do Catholics espouse according to the video?
answer: Three office form

question: What are the three offices in the Catholic form of church government?
answer: Bishops, priests, and deacons

question: What do most Protestants believe about divinely established offices?
options: Only one office was divinely established
Only two offices were divinely established: elders and deacons
answer: Only two offices were divinely established: elders and deacons

question: According to the video, when does most scholarship hold that there was a single bishop of Rome?
options: From the time of the apostles
From the end of the first century
Until the latter half of the 2nd century
answer: Until the latter half of the 2nd century

question: What does the New Testament do with bishops and elders according to the video?
answer: Conflates them

question: What are the two Greek words of concern mentioned in the video?
answer: Episcopos and presburos

question: What does episcopos generally mean?
answer: Overseer or bishop

question: What does presburos generally mean?
answer: Presbyter, elder, or priest

question: According to the video, when did bishop as a distinct office become universal?
options: During the time of the apostles
At the end of the second century
answer: At the end of the second century

question: How long after Peter's death did the office of bishop take shape in Rome according to the video?
answer: Around a century

question: Which church father is mentioned as coming to a similar conclusion about bishops and elders?
answer: St. Jerome

question: What is St. Jerome most famous for?
answer: Translating the Latin Vulgate

question: According to the video, what does Acts 20 show about bishops and elders?
options: Paul uses the two terms interchangeably
answer: Paul uses the two terms interchangeably

question: What does Titus 1:5-7 show according to the video?
options: Bishops and elders are distinct offices
Paul uses terms overseers and elders interchangeably when describing qualifications for church office
answer: Paul uses terms overseers and elders interchangeably when describing qualifications for church office

question: According to 1 Timothy 4:14, how was Timothy ordained?
answer: By the college of elders

question: What does Philippians 1:1 show according to the video?
options: There was one bishop per church
Bishops and elders were the same
There were multiple bishops at one church
answer: There were multiple bishops at one church

question: According to St. Jerome, why were bishops created?
options: As a divine command from Christ
As a practical necessity at the time to preserve unity
answer: As a practical necessity at the time to preserve unity

question: According to St. Jerome, where did the bishop originally derive his authority from?
options: From the choice of the presbyters
answer: From the choice of the presbyters

question: What does St. Jerome say the bishop is to the presbyters?
options: What an apostle is to a bishop
What a priest is to a deacon
What a pope is to a bishop
What an arch deacon is to the deacons
answer: What an arch deacon is to the deacons

question: According to the video, what does the idea that Peter had power over the other apostles contradict?
answer: Scripture

question: Who presides over the Jerusalem Council in Acts according to the video?
answer: James

question: What does the video say about Paul and Peter in Galatians?
options: Paul rebukes Peter publicly for a significant error
answer: Paul rebukes Peter publicly for a significant error

question: According to the video, who else is given the authority to bind and loose besides Peter?
options: The rest of the disciples in Matthew 18
answer: The rest of the disciples in Matthew 18

question: According to the video, what did the church fathers not have consensus on?
answer: What the "rock" in Matthew 16 was

question: What did Cyprian of Carthage say about the other apostles?
options: They were subject to Peter's authority
They had different roles than Peter
They were what Peter was, furnished with an equal share of honor and power
answer: They were what Peter was, furnished with an equal share of honor and power

question: According to the 1980s ecumenical dialogue mentioned in the video, what does the New Testament contain?
options: Explicit record of transmission of Peter's leadership
No explicit record of a transmission of Peter's leadership
answer: No explicit record of a transmission of Peter's leadership

question: According to the video, in what two senses is it possible to be successors of the apostles?
options: In common ministry and in special extraordinary work
answer: In common ministry and in special extraordinary work

question: What was a crucial part of the apostles' status according to the video?
options: Being eyewitnesses of the resurrected Christ
answer: Being eyewitnesses of the resurrected Christ

question: According to Matthew 19:28, what will the apostles do?
options: Sit on 12 thrones, judging the 12 tribes of Israel
answer: Sit on 12 thrones, judging the 12 tribes of Israel

question: According to the video, what do bishops and elders only succeed the apostles in?
answer: Ministry

question: According to the video, how many major patriarchates have claims of Petrine succession besides Rome?
answer: Two

question: Which city's bishops claim Petrine succession according to the video?
answer: Antioch

question: Through whom do the Coptic popes of Alexandria claim succession from Peter?
answer: Through Mark the Gospel writer

question: According to the video, what was the thing that distinguished Rome in the early church?
options: Largely secular and political status as cultural center and capital of empire
answer: Largely secular and political status as cultural center and capital of empire

question: According to the video, what should we believe St. Jerome when he tells us about bishops?
options: They were established by divine command
They were always distinct from elders
They were created as a practical organizational measure rather than as foundation of church legitimacy and authority
answer: They were created as a practical organizational measure rather than as foundation of church legitimacy and authority

question: What does the video say will be the focus of the next video?
options: Issues with later claims primarily supremacy and infallibility
answer: Issues with later claims primarily supremacy and infallibility

question: According to the video, what does the belief that episcopal church government was established by Christ run against?
options: The testimony of the scriptures and the early church
answer: The testimony of the scriptures and the early church
